detectors.description:
Version constraint ^0.8.0 contains known severe issues (https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/bugs.html)
	- FullInlinerNonExpressionSplitArgumentEvaluationOrder
	- MissingSideEffectsOnSelectorAccess
	- AbiReencodingHeadOverflowWithStaticArrayCleanup
	- DirtyBytesArrayToStorage
	- DataLocationChangeInInternalOverride
	- NestedCalldataArrayAbiReencodingSizeValidation
	- SignedImmutables
	- ABIDecodeTwoDimensionalArrayMemory
	- KeccakCaching.
It is used by:
	- ^0.8.0 (contracts/ReentrancyAttack.sol#2)

Parameter Token.transfer(address,uint256)._to (contracts/Token.sol#30) is not in mixedCase

Reentrancy in VulnerableBank.withdraw() (contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#12-21):
	External calls:
	- (success,None) = msg.sender.call{value: amount}() (contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#17)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- balances[msg.sender] = 0 (contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#20)
	VulnerableBank.balances (contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#5) can be used in cross function reentrancies:
	- VulnerableBank.balances (contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#5)
	- VulnerableBank.deposit() (contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#7-9)
	- VulnerableBank.withdraw() (contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#12-21)
detectors.markdown:
Reentrancy in [VulnerableBank.withdraw()](contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#L12-L21):
	External calls:
	- [(success,None) = msg.sender.call{value: amount}()](contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#L17)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- [balances[msg.sender] = 0](contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#L20)
	[VulnerableBank.balances](contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#L5) can be used in cross function reentrancies:
	- [VulnerableBank.balances](contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#L5)
	- [VulnerableBank.deposit()](contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#L7-L9)
	- [VulnerableBank.withdraw()](contracts/VulnerableBank.sol#L12-L21)
